channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: A woman in the trial in the UK had symptoms consistent with a rare but serious spinal inflammatory disorder, according to a report.
item.title: AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine trial volunteer 'had neurological symptoms'

item.description: Boris Johnson has announced new restrictions on social gatherings in England, saying there was a clear need to act after a spike in COVID-19 infections.
item.title: England tightens social distancing rules as COVID-19 infections spike

item.description: Ewan threw his bike forward over the line to narrowly beat triple world champion Peter Sagan, who was relegated for dangerous riding.
item.title: Australian Caleb Ewan wins tight sprint to claim Tour de France stage 11

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: A London court has been told that Donald Trump's hostility towards Barack Obama is partly why the Trump administration is pursuing Julian Assange over the publication of classified documents.
item.title: Trump is targeting Assange because he dislikes Obama, court told

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 10, 2020

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Nationals are "united in their anger" over the koala planning policy and will meet on Thursday morning to discuss the future of their role in the Coalition.
item.title: 'We will look at the whether the Coalition continues': crunch day in koala war

item.description: The Herald's Margaret Jones found herself virtually confined to her apartment as the Chinese took out their displeasure on foreign correspondents over the showing in Australia of the documentary 'Chung Kuo'.
item.title: From the Archives, 1974: Chinese refuse to dine with Australian envoy

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: As if Australia's border wars are not hot enough, Gladys Berejiklian has raised another potential source of rancourÂ in the federation.
item.title: As recession bites, GST threatens to stoke more tensions between states

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: NSW alone will cop a $10b hit from a collapse in GST revenue due to the coronavirus, new analysis shows.
item.title: NSW faces $10b hit from from GST shortfall, analysis shows

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Penrith players have brushed aside most of Campbell-Gillard's pot-shots since his defection to Parramatta. But they definitely haven't forgotten one incendiary comment.
item.title: Panthers still furious with Campbell-Gillard for saying he gave up on club

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Newborn Joey Tornatora was rushed by ambulance from the Tweed Hospital in northern NSW to the Mater Hospital in Brisbane the day after he was born. His parents are now at the mercy of border closures.
item.title: 'We can't go back home': Families and businesses hurt by border closures

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Suicide Prevention Australia chief executive Nieves Murray has warned of a delayed spike in deaths from self harm when the pandemic's economic impacts hit.
item.title: Suicide Prevention Australia warns of 'third wave' of deaths in pandemic

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: From phone taps to red envelopes, to visas cancellations, The Sydney Morning Herald and The Age have been following the Chinese Communist Party for half a century.
item.title: Covering the rise of the Communist Party until welcome mat withdrawn

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, September 10

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: The commissioner will push for meaningful progress towards equal promotion, closing the pay gap and reducing sexual harassment at work.
item.title: Gender commissioner will enforce equal opportunity laws across public service

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: At the peak of their career, teachers earn less than publicists and electricians, an analysis of salaries by a Sydney University professor has found.
item.title: Top teachers should have a 50 per cent pay rise, expert says

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: UQ experts will spend three years devising a completely new training program to help Queensland police officers deal with child abuse cases.
item.title: Police go back to drawing board to equip officers for child abuse cases

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, September 10

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Thursday is Suicide Prevention day and R U OK day â but calls to Lifeline are already up 30 per cent on the same day last year.
item.title: Not a record anyone wants: Calls to Lifeline hit a daily high

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Nine design teams were commissioned to provide the public with a glimpse into the future of home furnishings and objects.
item.title: Designers and researchers join forces to imagine the home of the future

item.description: The pandemic political discourse has been lacking in grace.
item.title: PM's blame game no help, apologies to Melbourne

item.description: COVID-19 is putting worrying pressure on Australians, writes the Lifeline chairman and former NSW opposition leader.
item.title: Why Iâm worried about suicide in Australia (by a former political leader who personally knows the risks)

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Digital lender Plenti is hoping to cash in on major players retreating from the car loan market as it aims to raise $55 million from investors.Â
item.title: Plenti punts on car finance as it plots IPO

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Johnnie Ray's wild welcome, frozen assets and wistaria carnival.
item.title: In the Herald: September 10, 1954

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The head of eBay Australia says the online shopping giant won't boot local buy now, pay later operators off its platform once PayPal's new offering becomes available.
item.title: Ebay won't ditch Afterpay for longtime pal PayPal, says local boss

item.dc:creator: Geoff Kitney
item.description: Only a scattering of MPs were present to hear Pauline Hanson's "extraordinary" maiden speech to Federal Parliament.
item.title: From the Archives, 1996: The lesson in Pauline's perils

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Australia's Woodstock for Conservatives is gearing up for a reboot. And Labor's Kristina Keneally has been given a central role.
item.title: Keneally the (unwitting) star of conservative hoe-down

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: Seniors such as Raissa Outchitel are benefiting from a scheme to compensate for the closure of Port Phillip's multicultural clubs.
item.title: 'I'm happy you don't forget about us': Meals program helps seniors feel connected

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: New modelling shows the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic on inner Melbourne will be far worse than the 1990s recession, costing 79,000 jobs annually over the next five years.
item.title: Inner Melbourne economy tipped to suffer $110b hit over five years

item.description: New research shows that while people might rate a man with a muscular body as more attractive, we're also likely to take a dim view of their child-rearing skills - not to mention their monogamy.
item.title: Do men with dad bods make better fathers?

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Two former Victorian premiers from opposing sides of politics are uniting in a push to secure world heritage recognition for the state's goldfields.
item.title: Past premiers join forces to push goldfields' world heritage hopes

item.dc:creator: Henrietta Cook
item.description: Have you visited a public site? Dropped a child off at school? The questions put to suspected COVID-19 cases by disease detectives.
item.title: The questions suspected COVID-19 cases are asked

item.dc:creator: Shaun Carney
item.description: The Prime Minister might have been better served this week to talk more about Victorians and less about the Victorian government.
item.title: Has Scott Morrison forgotten that he's Victoria's Prime Minister, too?

item.description: Why are funerals deemed safer than weddings?
item.title: Road map's risk management doesn't always make a lot of sense

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Economists are now largely in favour of further tax relief to increase incentives to work and boost potential consumer spending.
item.title: Morrison must deliver the full tax-cut meat pie

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australia has suffered a $20 billion slump in major project approvals since the coronavirus crisis began, shrinking the pipeline of new construction on the way.
item.title: Jobs at risk from $20 billion slump in road, rail projects

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: The Brisbane Lions have again risen to the top two on the AFL ladder thanks to a thumping 45-point over the Gold Coast Suns.
item.title: Lions lock jaws on top-two spot

item.description: It's the second time the Norwegian lawmaker has put forward the US President for the award.
item.title: Donald Trump nominated for Nobel Peace Prize by right-wing Norwegian MP

item.description: The deal, which would have been the biggest-ever in the luxury industry, had raised questions about whether the French luxury goods giant was overpaying.
item.title: LVMH drops $22 billion Tiffany takeover, setting stage for legal battle

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A collapse in GST revenues this year and out to the rest of the decade threatens the budget bottom line of every state and territory.
item.title: States and territories facing years of massive GST shortfall

item.description: We're hoping your incarceration will be brief.
item.title: Keep your chin up, Chesty Bond

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Five new cases were added to the Sydney hospitals cluster and investigations continue into the source of the infections.
item.title: Hospital cluster grows to 12 cases as further venue alerts issued

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Hotel quarantine security boss said "not sure based on history" that Health Department's PPE standards were "what we should be aspiring to."
item.title: 'Remember the Rydges!': Security boss warned against Health Department advice

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Modelling used by the Victorian government to justify its strict lockdown regime is based on outdated contact tracing methods. NSW has issued health alerts for a cafe, malls, gym and a golf club.
item.title: As it happened: Victoria records 76 new COVID-19 cases as AstraZeneca pauses vaccine study; Sydney pub ordered to close as Australian death toll jumps to 781

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Caitlin Bassett finally came onto the court during the third quarter and her arrival lifted her team.
item.title: Bassett's injection swings the game as Giants keep finals dreams alive

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The keen 46-year-old surfer, who called the Gold Coast home and was a father to a teenage son, was bitten while surfing at Greenmount Beach on Tuesday evening.
item.title: Beaches to reopen as tributes flow for 'down to earth' Nick Slater

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: The secondment of two key staffers from embattled public insurance giant icare, which forced the resignation of the NSW Treasurer's most senior adviser, was unlawful, according to a committee hearing.
item.title: Employment of icare staffers in Treasurer's office unlawful: hearing

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Brisbane had been slated to kickstart the eagerly awaited rematch between Australia and India but the complexities around planning international cricket in a pandemic has cast that into doubt.
item.title: Australia set to lose huge edge as hopes of Gabba Test opener fade

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Greens are calling for a building boom worth up to $225 billion to create new social housing and faster public transport rather than spending on tax cuts.
item.title: Build new projects instead of speeding up personal tax cuts, say Greens
